====Usage notes====
This character is not used much in modern Japanese.

===Etymology 1===
Alternative spelling of {{ja-l|杖||tsue}}. See that entry for details.

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|つえ|hhira=つゑ}}

# {{alternative spelling of|lang=ja|sort=つえ|杖|dot=:}} a [[cane]], a [[crook]], a [[walking stick]]

===Etymology 2===
Alternative spelling of {{ja-l|兵||tsuwamono}}. See that entry for details.

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|つわもの|hhira=つはもの}}

# {{alternative spelling of|lang=ja|sort=つわもの|兵|dot=:}} [[weaponry]]; a [[soldier]], a [[warrior]]; a [[courageous]] person, a [[brave]]; someone who is very [[confident]], even [[obstinate]]

===Etymology 3===
Alternative spelling of {{ja-l|回り}}, {{ja-l|周り}}, {{ja-l|廻り||mawari}}. See those entries for details.

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|まわり|hhira=まはり}}

# {{alternative spelling of|lang=ja|sort=まわり|回り|dot=, etc.:}} [[surroundings]]; [[around]]; [[turning]]

===Etymology 4===
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=しょう'}} {{m|ltc|仗}}. Compare modern {{cog|cmn|仗|tr=zhàng}}.

====Affix====
{{ja-pos|affix|じょう|hhira=ぢやう}}

# [[military]] [[strength]]
# [[reliable]], [[dependable]]

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-l|仗旗|じょうき|jōki}}: in [[medieval]] times, a special [[imperial]] [[flag]] marking occasions of special [[dignity]], such as the first day of a new emperor's [[reign]]
* {{ja-l|仗議}}, {{ja-l|仗儀|じょうぎ|jōgi}}: in the [[w:Nara period|Nara period]], a kind of [[codify|codified]] [[conference]] before the [[imperial]] [[court]], whereby [[公家#Japanese|noble]]s below the rank of [[minister]] would discuss the business of [[government]]
* {{ja-l|仗座|じょうざ|jōza}}: the [[seat]]s of the [[imperial|Imperial]] [[guard|Guard]]; where [[公家#Japanese|noble]]s would sit to offer [[counsel]] to the [[court]]
* {{ja-l|仗身|じょうしん|jōshin}}: in the [[w:Nara period|Nara period]], the [[court]]-appointed [[bodyguard]] of officials of fifth or higher rank
{{der-bottom}}
